page.title: 08AIRPORT SITE AND SERVICES
page.content: Teesside airport was developed here because the land was flat, away from the towns and was an old RAF station, and it opened as a civil airport in 1960. Most flights are internal and go to London, Norwich, Humberside, Glasgow and Inverness. There are 67 internal flights per week and only 37 inter- national ones, flying to Belfast, Bergen, Stavanger, Esbjerg, Amsterdam and Berlin. During the summer, additional holiday flights go to Spain, Germany, Holland and Yugoslavia. As the airport expanded a railway station was built. Whilst further expansion is possible on existing owned land, current national policies do not favour provincial development.
